solution_line_template: Since June has {days_in_june} days, halfway is {halfway_fraction}*{days_in_june} = <<{halfway_fraction}*{days_in_june}={days_halfway_through_june}>>{days_halfway_through_june}

The total number of video hours halfway through June is {videos_per_day_initial}*{days_halfway_through_june} = <<{videos_per_day_initial}*{days_halfway_through_june}={total_video_hours_halfway}>>{total_video_hours_halfway}

When she doubled the number of video hours, the total per day became {videos_per_day_initial}*{doubling_factor} = <<{videos_per_day_initial}*{doubling_factor}={videos_per_day_doubled}>>{videos_per_day_doubled}

The total number of video hours for the remaining days is {remaining_days}*{videos_per_day_doubled} = <<{remaining_days}*{videos_per_day_doubled}={total_video_hours_remaining}>>{total_video_hours_remaining}

The total number of video hours for the whole month is {total_video_hours_remaining}+{total_video_hours_halfway} = <<{total_video_hours_remaining}+{total_video_hours_halfway}={total_video_hours_month}>>{total_video_hours_month}
